issue.title: [Rust] packed_simd is broken and continued under a new project
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-10271](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10271). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The dependency doesn't compile on newer versions of nightly. This is also known by the (new) project maintainers. Due to complications they continued the project under a new name: `packed_simd_2`.

 
packed_simd = { version = "0.3.4", package = "packed_simd_2" }
 

See:

https://github.com/rust-lang/packed_simd

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10271?focusedCommentId=17211839) by Neville Dipale (nevi_me):*
I was planning on doing a pass to check if there's dependencies that we could bump. I'm aware of the packed_simd_2 change, and was planning on addressing it.

While we use an old nightly (call it a six-monthly at this stage), this issue will definitely break a lot of code for users.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10271?focusedCommentId=17211964) by Andy Grove (andygrove):*
Issue resolved by pull request 8433
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8433>
